title: The Power Play: How AI is Redefining the Physical World of Real Estate
description: Artificial intelligence is often discussed as a digital phenomenon. It is viewed as code, algorithms, and virtual assistants. However, the reality of AI is deeply physical. Behind every line of generated text and every processed image lies a massive industrial infrastructure of servers, high-voltage wires, and specialized cooling systems. This physical foundation is the new […]

title: Indian-origin scientist Meha Jain wins global science prize for climate research
description: By combining satellite imagery with artificial intelligence, Meha Jain’s research tracks how small farmers respond to climate stress, and at what environmental cost.

title: Big Tech's $600 billion spending plans exacerbate investors' AI headache
description: NEW YORK/LONDON ― A planned $600 billion artificial intelligence spending splurge by big tech firms in 2026 is adding to investor unease as they assess the implications for profitability as well as a potential existential threat to software firms.

title: The AI infrastructure challenge: Preparing for the agentic AI revolution
description: AROUND the world, governments and industries are moving quickly to secure leadership in artificial intelligence. For many countries, this momentum intersects with pressing demographic realities: aging populations, shrinking workforces and the urgent need to reinvent productivity. We cannot afford to fall behind. The rise of agentic AI promises to accelerate this transformation.

title: Who is responsible when AI gives advice?
description: ACROSS my Smarter With AI book tour — through business and campus roadshows and informal conversations — one observation keeps resurfacing: people are no longer using artificial intelligence merely as a tool. They are using it as a coach for business decisions, marketing direction, productivity struggles and, increasingly, personal life questions. This reflects how quickly AI has become woven into everyday decision-making.
